title: Great Company. Bright Future.

cons: A lot of redundancy in reporting and positions (corporate).

title: 4 out of 5 stars

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Opportunities to build long lasting professional relationships. I have had the ability to be promoted multiple times based on my work ethic and productivity. Tanger is built on wonderful values, including employing people of different backgrounds including; racial diversity, age diversity, religious diversity and LGBTQ+ diversity.
cons: For my position, pay is well under current industry standards.

title: It was good and bad
pros: The people at corporate and different centers were great.
cons: There was a very negative employee that brought moral down for all and caused problems.

title: Great place to work
pros: I loved the staff and meeting new customers.
cons: Crazy during the holiday seasons.

title: balanced

title: Okay for pay for job

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Tanger has one of the best team environments I've been a part of.
cons: Stock compensation is only accessible to SVP's and above.

title: Great
pros: Great company to work for. Flexible. Fun.
cons: Hard to move up the ladder

title: Unconventional and Unprofessional MGR
pros: Meeting new people and schedule flexibility
cons: I was hired as CSR in a office to service Tanger members and to sign new memberships. Here lately management is having CSR outside in 100 degree weather and in thunderstorms for membership. We are not getting bonuses or anything to run down people for membership outside. Other Tanger outlets don't have there CSR outside especially in bad weather Everyday or Every weekend. We be the only people outside no other at tanger has there employees out in heat or rain. Management requesting us to run down customer's for pics on our personal phone with no cell phone reimbursements. There is a marketing manager but not sure what marketing she is doing if CSR is hassling people. They wonder why employee's leave or call out because Management don't care about the little people as long as they get to sit in there offices. I applied for this position because it was a office position and now it's all about numbers and hassling customer's like we sale cars but we don't get commission like a car salemen. If you want csr outside or taking pic ask for volunteers not make demands and include that in the job description.

title: Review
pros: Summer job - decent hours/pay for students
cons: Must be customer friendly with sales

title: disrespect
pros: dont work at tanger outlet their rude
cons: rude nasty bathrooms nasty people

title: Pretty Great Job
pros: Flexible scheduling good work environment shorter shifts which can be good and bad good management Small yearly raise Finally started doing performance review raises Great job for students and anyone who needs flexible scheduling
cons: A lot of management/corporate turnover and change in the company recently No uniform updates in many years Little to no ability to move up by promotion Little or no corporate incentives for sales goals No benefits or paid holidays for part time employees even though you can be working 5-6 days a week at times. No full time customer service positions which can be hard for anyone who wants long term employment.

title: Cares about employees
pros: Management seems to really care about your personal life, is understanding when you need time off for your family or appointments or just for a personal day. I'm given lots of autonomy. HR organizes a lot of fun events (usually with free food!!) during the work day. Benefits are good. Family-oriented.
cons: I feel like I could be paid a bit more. Company is very traditional, if you're not married with kids you might feel left out. Low turnover means little chance for advancement unless you're in it for the long haul (15+ years).

title: I currently work part-time
pros: passive income, nice customers, customer service experience, money handling experience, previous management was compassionate and understanding.
cons: management has the inability to work with employees, micromanagement, uniform, no benefits for part-time employees, management has no communication skills, management does not appreciate good employees but instead overworks them and allows the bad employees to breeze by, not considerate of employees with small children, holiday hours, corporate wants an employee with experience and education but fails to train them appropriately thus leaving a know-it-all employee who is not skilled in the company, management is completely over worked thus creating chaos, no direct instruction, etc.

title: Company is good but some departments are'nt
pros: Vibrant company, hard working and enthusiastic people, CEO shares vision with everyone, excellent company activities, brilliant marketing department and great on-boarding.
cons: A few departments have high levels of work stress as they are understaffed and people have to wear many hats. Working always was an unspoken expectation. Treatment to exiting employees was poor. Compensation is average.

title: Great Company
pros: Work well with school schedules and second job schedules. Great manager at this location Fun to come to work
cons: No insurance available for part time employees anymore Only part-time positions available now Not much room for advancement

title: Potential not being recognized
pros: The pay for contract work was good. Most of the employees were a pleasure to work with, upper management being the exception.
cons: Communication was terrible. Temporary employees were not treated equally. There was no personal growth even though the opportunity was there. There are current employees who are toxic to growth. There was no internal culture or values that maintained the staffs direction. Upper management was distant and unfriendly.

title: Originally they valued employees, now just profit
pros: The company is driven but undergoing a lot of cultural changes within the last year.
cons: Culture has shifted from organized, pride in center and customer experience and valuing the employees of the company to profit over people

title: First Choice Employer
pros: Tanger cares about you having a work life balance. They believe in promoting from within if you meet the qualifications. The support received from the corporate office is phenomenal. While it is a large company, it feels like a family.
cons: Nothing that I'd care to share because Tanger has an open door policy that allows you to bring your concerns forth for true resolutions.

title: Great experience w/ Tanger
pros: The opportunity to move up with Tanger has been the highlight of my career. Tanger supports employees by offering an educational reimbursement program and support towards obtaining professional designations. This support has helped me personally and professionally grow and ultimately be promoted within the organization.
cons: The benefits are great but the family medical coverage is a bit on the high side.

title: Decent Company - Decent Benefits - Sub Par Pay
pros: Field management teams is a more relaxed environment Decent health insurance and 401k match Can have flexible schedule for appointments etc.
cons: Sub par pay compared to competitors Have to work for company for 20 years to get max PTO (4 week) Work - home life balance. Regional managers have too much power / not enough supervision.

title: Easy job
pros: Easy position. Working as a CSR in the mall management office can get hectic during the holidays. Aside from that, the position is very relaxed.
cons: Tanger wants you to push Tanger club memberships, if your good at sales this likely won’t be an issue. My problem was, it’s hard for me to push something if I don’t see the value.

title: Needs Work
pros: Great coworkers, beautiful properties, nice public events
cons: Aggressive memos from management, clique environment among managers, no advancement, no benefits for part time, job description says 29 hours per wee part time and you get more like 12 per week. No incentives for part time employees all positions part time.

title: A great company that promotes from within!
pros: Tanger Outlets is a great place to work! The company really cares about its employees, the pay and benefits are great and they provide a very thorough training.
cons: There aren’t any cons really. It’s just a good company all the way around.

title: Great company to work for!
pros: Good benefits Annual review cycle and merit-based raises Opportunity for growth Great learning programs Fun events and team building projects
cons: Requires working overtime to meet deadlines on occasion, but that is very common for this field and expected.

title: Great laid back place to work for. Not a lot of advancement
pros: Wonderful place to work for. Management was fantastic and pay was decent when I was younger working there.
cons: Not a lot of growth if you were looking for advancement in the company

title: Corporate employee
pros: Good benefits, great marketing department!
cons: You are a number and not an employee with a name. Company does not recognize loyalty, hard work and dedication.

title: Great company!
pros: Tanger Outlets was a great company to work for. They care about their employees and provide great work life balance. Leadership is approachable and values the opinions of all teammates.
cons: I would recommend this company to friends and family.

title: Nice environment
pros: Discounts, meals, great training, managers always on call to answer questions,
cons: Customers can be super rude and wrong but no matter what they are always right here even if they are very very wrong. Management did not protect staff

title: Great Atmosphere
pros: With few exceptions, the entire team at Tanger is a joy to work with. Personal growth is encouraged.
cons: Poor insurance. Make other plans if you need to insure your family.

title: It was fine when I worked there.
pros: Family-run, creative, high emphasis on quality work in every aspect of property management.
cons: It has been reorganized and I no longer know anything about what it is like to work there.

title: Amazing place to work!
pros: Tanger is a great company that truly cares about their employees! They often promote from within and there are numerous opportunities for advancement.
cons: The benefits are good, but could be improved.
